import requests
import json
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

if use_test_env:
    stage1 = 'abfss://test-env@' + storage_account + '.dfs.core.windows.net/stage1'
    stage2 = 'abfss://test-env@' + storage_account + '.dfs.core.windows.net/stage2'
    stage3 = 'abfss://test-env@' + storage_account + '.dfs.core.windows.net/stage3'
else:
    stage1 = 'abfss://stage1@' + storage_account + '.dfs.core.windows.net'
    stage2 = 'abfss://stage2@' + storage_account + '.dfs.core.windows.net'
    stage3 = 'abfss://stage3@' + storage_account + '.dfs.core.windows.net'

keyVaultName = "oladevkeyvault"
secretKey = "olaoauth2functionkey"
linkedServiceName = "AzureKeyVault"

ss = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
sc = spark.sparkContext

token_library = ss._jvm.com.microsoft.azure.synapse.tokenlibrary.TokenLibrary
code = token_library.getSecret(keyVaultName, secretKey, linkedServiceName)
oAuth2TokenUrl = f"https://olaoauth2.azurewebsites.net/api/GetOAuth2Token?code={code}"
r = requests.get(oAuth2TokenUrl)
tokenJson = json.loads(r.text);
bearerToken = f"Bearer {tokenJson['token']}"

googleClassroomBaseUrl = "https://classroom.googleapis.com/v1/"
googleClassroomRelativeUrl = "courses"
headers = {"Authorization" : bearerToken}

r = requests.get(f"{googleClassroomBaseUrl}{googleClassroomRelativeUrl}", headers=headers)
df = spark.read.json(sc.parallelize([r.text]))
df.write.format('json').mode('overwrite').save(stage1 + '/googleclassroom/courses')
